intro: Psorospermum stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features include woody stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has limited use in traditional medicine.
